chargeHist.descr: Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark William Ihrcke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Mark William Ihrcke.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Mark William Ihrcke.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy R. Ancil. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Mark William Ihrcke.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for an Indigency hearing proceeded.  Defendant's appearance is waived. Defendant is unable to retain private counsel on this case, defense request to be appointed to this case. The court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Lori Kuehn to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $25.00 per month beginning on 11-01-2022   and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Court vacates the status of counsel date on the preliminary hearing calendar and set matter over for a Preliminary hearing in Preliminary hearing court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defendant is not SPD Eligible and has not officially retained counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Kuehn has not been appointed in this matter. Defendant to retain private counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Patrick Anderson.
Case in court for an indigency hearing.  Court finds the defendant is NOT indigent.  Defendant intends to hire private counsel.  Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch PE.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report 8.5.22

Court ordered no contact with R A; G C; W S; Froedtert Hospital.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark William Ihrcke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 22CF2839 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Defendant request an indigency hearing. 
Indigency hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
